value.title: Discovering data within Power BI and quickly EXPORT!
value.excerpt: Sometimes you just don't know what data is out there in Power BI. Patrick shows you how you can discover data available to you and also how to quickly export that data! Even with just a Pro account!  Data discovery using the data hub https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/connect-data/service-data-hub?tabs=datasets
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/eviMr_f_LQM" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Do we need more Power BI Premium Capacity?
value.excerpt: Capacity planning for Power BI Premium is not an exact science. How much capacity do you need? As with most things, it depends! Adam walks through some things to consider when thinking about your planning.  Premium Gen2 capacity load evaluation https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/admin/service-premium-concepts

value.title: Does it matter where your Power BI reports are deployed?
value.excerpt: Where to deploy your Power BI Report? My Workspace? Regular Workspace? What about Apps? Adam breaks it down to help you make the right choice and understand why it matters!  üì¢ Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************  Want to take your Power BI skills to the next level?

value.title: How do I get my Excel users to use Power BI???
value.excerpt: Lots of people use Excel and love it! But what about Power BI? Why not use both together? Patrick looks at how Excel users can take advantage of Power BI and may just start using that!  Start in Excel to connect to Power BI datasets https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/collaborate-share/service-connect-excel-power-bi-datasets

value.title: Power BI parameters - Updating in the Power BI Service or with APIs
value.excerpt: In this video, Adam looks at how you can update Power BI parameters within the service or by using APIs. You can create Power BI Parameters within Power BI Desktop using Power Query. value.excerpt: The Power BI PowerShell and the Admin API allow you to quickly inventory your organization and manage workspaces and access. Forget the hastle of setting up the App registration within Azure Active Directory for API access, the Power BI PowerShell cmdlets take care of it for you. Just install and start
